intro: Eriocoma gracilis, commonly known as the slender eriocoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, cylindrical fruits. Eriocoma gracilis is often found in open vegetation and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
